title.narrative: Program for Country Partnership (PCP) for Côte d#Ivoire: «Inclusive and Sustainable Industrialization Program in Côte d#Ivoire»

description.narrative: Origin of the Proposal: Since 2013, the United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO) was given a new mandate by its Member States at the fifteenth session of the UNIDO General Conference. This new mandate aims to promote Inclusive and Sustainable Industrial Development (ISID) in all its Member States. This new mandate therefore requires new approaches to support the industrialization of countries. They focus on national ownership and the promotion of partnership around industrial development programs. In a bid to expeditiously operationalize this new mandate, UNIDO has developed a new technical support approach referred to as the Program for Country Partnership (PCP). It encompasses the economic, social and environmental dimensions of development. The PCP is a comprehensive mechanism of consultation, sensitization, project formulation and development of an industrialization strategy, implemented by States, using partnerships and funding. In addition, the United Nations General Assembly, at its 70th session on 26 September 2015, proclaimed the period 2016-2025 as the Third Industrial Development for Africa (IDDA 3).
